result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Freson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J. Freson

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: cc: DA(efile), Defendant(mail), Ozaukee Co. Jail(mail) 2/10/2020--ma

[MK] case called at 11:12am
Defendant Justin J. Freson appears via videoconferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
After making inquiries of Mr. Freson regarding his ability to see and hear the proceedings, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Freson makes a statement in support of his Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  
DA Happ gives argument in opposition to the Petition. 
The Court denies the Petition for Sentence Adjustment.
recess 11:21am.
Sentence adjustment review on February 7, 2020 at 11:00 am.
DA Response on Petition Sentence Adjustment
Notice to DA on Petition for Sentence Adjustment

records.addlTxt:
Cases 16CF53,16CF238,16CF332,16CF342,16CF346 called together at 2:00pm [ma]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court, in custody with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Cases 16CF342 and 16CF346, Arraignment occurs, Atty. Svehlek admits service and waives reading of the Information.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 16CF238
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 16CF53
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1 of Case 16CF332
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts  #1 and #2 of Case 16CF342
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts  #3 and #4 of Case 16CF346

Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Freson

On Count #1 of Case 16CF53, the Court IMPOSES a sentence of 4 years on Imprisonment, consisting of 2 years Initial Confinement, followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to any sentence previously imposed and sentences ordered today; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Freson on Probation for a period of 4 years.

On Count #1 of Case 16CF238, the Court IMPOSES a sentence of 4 years on Imprisonment, consisting of 2 years Initial Confinement, followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to any sentence previously imposed and sentences ordered today; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Freson on Probation for a period of 4 years.

On Count #3 of Case 16CF346, the Court IMPOSES a sentence of 2 years Imprisonment, consisting of 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement, followed by 6 months Extended Supervision, consecutive to any sentence previously imposed and sentences ordered today; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Freson on Probation for a period of 2 years.
The Court finds Mr. Freson eligible for SAP and CIP eligible for Count #3

On Count #4 of Case 16CF346, the Court IMPOSES a sentence of 2 years Imprisonment, consisting of 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement, followed by 6 months Extended Supervision, concurrent to sentence in Count #3 of 16CF346; the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Freson on Probation for a period of 2 years.

On Count #1 of Case 16CF332: the Court sentences Mr. Freson to 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber, to commence FORTHWITH
---Mr.Freson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to pay statutory costs, to be converted to civil judgment
 
On Count #1 of Case 16CF342: the Court sentences Mr. Freson to 4 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber, consecutive to sentence in 16CF332 and any other sentence in being
---Mr.Freson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to pay statutory costs, to be converted to civil judgement 

On Count #2 of Case 16CF342: the Court sentences Mr. Freson to 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber, consecutive to sentence in 16CF332, 16CF342 Count #1, and any other sentence in being
---Mr.Freson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to pay statutory costs, to be converted to civil judgment

The Court authorizes transfer of jail sentences to Dodge Co., so long as it is without electronic monitoring.
The Court does authorize Huber privileges, but NOT for family care.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent                                                             
--no presence in any bar, tavern or liquor store
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol or any illegal drugs
--no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--no contact with any known drug offender unless authorized by DOC
--random drug/alcohol screens per DOC
--no direct or indirect contact with Jodi Freson, NMZ(dob 9/21/09), NJZ(dob 11/17/06), AF(4/14/05), unless such contact is approved by DOC; and authorized by any existing juvenile/family court orders
--not to engage in any physical discipline of any child
--comply with any requirements of juvenile court orders for NMZ, NJZ, or AF
--comply with any requirements of any family court orders for LKF
--shall not have unsupervised contact with any children, unless approved by the DOC and not prohibited by juvenile or family court orders 
--to pay statutory costs
--to submit DNA sample


Days credit for time already served:  7  days, 16CF53
Days credit for time already served:  22  days, 16CF332
All other cases 0 days credit

Cash Bond to be applied to costs/fees
recess: 3:16pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
with criminal case settlement and JI's/elements forms attached

[prior to hearing: Atty. Svehlek submits plea and sentencing paperwork]

NEXT:  As to All Cases: Argued Plea and Sentencing on 9/26/16 at 1:45pm//Arraignment to occur for cases 16CF342 and 16CF346
Duplicate Original Warrant received with copy of Warrant Cancellation Notice
Status conference on September 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases #16CF53 and Case #16CF238 are addressed during the Initial Appearance in newly filed case #16CF346. The minutes from that hearing are:  
[MK] cases #16CF346 called at 2:30pm. 
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to commit any acts of violence or make any threats
--no contact with Joshua Mueller, Nathan Moralez, Brandon Frisbe
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol 
or illegal drugs
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

Thereafter the Court hears arguments on the State's Motion to Modify Bond in Case #16CF53.  
In Case #16CF53 the Court requires a $3,000 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. The Court clarifies: at this point $1,500 additional cash is needed in order for Mr. Freson to be released from custody on this case. While the Court finds that the previously posted $1500 Cash Bond is in default, the Court cannot proceed with addressing that Bond forfeiture today because notice to the Surety is needed.  If the bond is eventually forfeited, then additional funds will need to be posted for Mr. Freson to remain released from custody.  
The Court issues the Warrant in Case #15CF53 but then indicates that Mr. Freson has now appeared on the Warrant. 
After the clerk raises that the current bond form mistakenly lists a wrong second case number, the Court directs the clerk to prepare the $3,000 Cash Bond with both cases #16CF53 and #16CF238 listed, so that the second case number is accurately reflected on the Bond form.  
 recess 2:47pm. 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing in case #16CF346 on 9/23/16 at 8:30am

This Amended Bond applies to both Case #16CF53 and #16CF238.  $1,500 of this Bond amount was posted on 9/1/16, so the posting of $1,500 additional funds is needed in order for Mr. Freson to be released on this Amended Bond.   
(While the Court has found that 9/1/16 $1,500 Cash Bond to be in default, it has not been forfeited as of yet, so may be applied as a portion of the $3,000 amount requirement. However notice is given that if the 9/1/16 $1,500 Cash Bond is eventually ordered forfeited, then Mr. Freson will need to post an additional $1,500 at that future time, in order to remain released from custody in this case.)
Extradition Forecast
STATES NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR BOND MODIFICATION

Cases 16CF53 & 16CT6 called together at 10:51 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mac J. Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CT6:  Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $484.50; due in $25 incriments per month, beginning 9/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 10 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
To submit a DNA Sample

3 demerit points assessed
No driver license revocation
